rComments: He does have an accent but he explains everything very clearly. He actually works through problems and explains how he goes about them. Best math prof I've had at UIUC.

I don't understand all these people who complain about Professor Nikolaev.  The class was very easy as long as you do the homework.  His lectures were very helpful understanding the material.  As it is calculus 3, its not easy to get a good grade with out putting in much effort, but definately one of the best professors you can have for math 241.

Horrible textbook first of all.  Tests seem easy however grading is very harsh.  Questions seem unrelated to concepts taught in class.  Hard to follow lectures due to complex notation that is not explained.  Friends in Denka's class say she is a better professor.  Avoid Igor in 241 if possible.
His accent is really not bad AT ALL. His tests are VERY fair if you do the homework.  He does a pretty good job explaining things. I'd recommend taking a course with him if you have the option.
This man is horrible, thick accent, doesn't explain things well, and impossible to understand his lectures... the only thing good about him was that the tests weren't that hard and one got curved.

Explains lots of examples in lecture, and posts everything online.  Tests are very reasonable but might catch you off guard if you aren't prepared.  The grading is also very beneficial.  Best math teacher I had at U of I, is also easy to understand so don't be discouraged by the name.

One of the best math teachers I have ever had, I learned so much, and on top of that his class and tests weren't overly hard.  You have to apply yourself a little in his class, but if you do you won't have too hard a time.
